overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data, focusing on handling anomalies and leveraging observed daily seasonality. It emphasizes practical adaptation to data constraints by excluding an anomalous constant-value day and using a heuristic averaging method. The analysis is thorough but constrained by the small dataset, leading to a simplified solution.
common_data_patterns: Anomaly detection (constant-value day identified as unreliable)
Handling of potential missing values (explicitly checked and excluded)
key_insights: Exclusion of anomalous data (constant-value day) to avoid skewing forecasts
Use of multi-day hourly averaging to capture daily patterns despite limited historical data
Repetition of averaged daily cycles for multi-step forecasting
Explicit consideration of day-of-week effects, though deemed impractical due to insufficient data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed anomaly handling and manual pattern extraction; balances statistical awareness (seasonality, overfitting risks) with pragmatic heuristics due to data limitations.
